main_definition: A negating expression; an answer that shows disagreement or disapproval

meanings_and_examples.definition: A negating expression; an answer that shows disagreement or disapproval
meanings_and_examples.example: When asked if he wanted to go out for dinner, John replied with a firm 'No, I can't tonight. I already have plans.'

meanings_and_examples.definition: A vote not in favor, or opposing a proposition
meanings_and_examples.example: The workers voted on whether to strike, and there were thirty "yeses" and two "nos".

meanings_and_examples.definition: (now only used with different, with comparatives more and less, and informally with certain other adjectives such as good and fun) Not, not at all.
meanings_and_examples.example: I just want to find out whether she's coming or no. (Scotland)
After the company cut costs, there was no longer a budget for employee training.
When asked if she wanted to go out for dinner, she gave a firm 'no' as if saying that the idea was not appealing or interesting to her.
